getObject

public static OAObject getObject(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                 java.lang.Object key)
DataSource independent method to retrieve an object. Find the OAObject given a key value. This will look in the Cache, Server (if running as workstation) and the DataSource (if not running as workstation).

Parameters:
clazz - class of reference of to find.
key - can be the value of the key or an OAObjectKey

getObject

public static OAObject getObject(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                 java.lang.Object key,
                                 OAObjectInfo oi)

getReferenceHub

public static Hub getReferenceHub(OAObject oaObj,
                                  java.lang.String linkPropertyName,
                                  java.lang.String sortOrder,
                                  boolean bSequence,
                                  Hub hubMatch)
DataSource independent method to retrieve a reference property that is a Hub Collection.

Parameters:
linkPropertyName - name of property to retrieve. (case insensitive)
sortOrder -
bStore - if true (default), then reference object/Hub is stored internally.

If Hub is not already loaded then, hub is created by:
Hub h = new Hub(linkClass, this, linkPropertyName);
h.setSelectOrder(sortOrder);
h.executeSelectLater();

bSequence - if true, then create a hub sequencer to manager the order of the objects in the hub.

getRawReference

public static java.lang.Object getRawReference(OAObject oaObj,
                                               java.lang.String name)
This method is used to get the value of a relationship. Calling it will not load objects. To load objects, call getReferenceHub(name) or getReferenceObject(name)

Returns:
one of the following: null, OAObjectKey, OAObject, Hub of OAObjects, Hub of OAObjectKeys
See Also:
#isPropertyLoaded, to have the OAObject returned., to have a Hub of OAObjects returned.

loadAllReferences

public static void loadAllReferences(OAObject obj,
                                     int levelsLoaded,
                                     int maxLevelsToLoad,
                                     int additionalOwnedLevelsToLoad,
                                     boolean bIncludeCalc,
                                     OACallback callback,
                                     OACascade cascade)
Parameters:
levelsLoaded - number of levels of references that have been loaded.
maxLevelsToLoad - max levels of references to recursively load.
additionalOwnedLevelsToLoad - additional levels of owned references to load
bIncludeCalc - include calculated links
callback - will be called before loading references. If the callback.updateObject returns false, then the current object references will not be loaded
cascade - used to impl vistor pattern

releasePropertyLock

getPropertyObjectKey

public static OAObjectKey getPropertyObjectKey(OAObject oaObj,
                                               java.lang.String property)
Used to retrieve a reference key without actually loading the object. Datasourcs stores the key value for references, that are then used to retrieve the object when requested using getObject(property). This method is a way to get the key, without loading the object.

Returns:
the OAObjectKey of a ONE reference. Does not call getMethod, but internally stored value.
See Also:
to see if object has been loaded and exists in memory. isLoaded will return false if the property has never been set, or loaded, or if the objectKey has been set and the object for the key is not in memory. This method will always return the objectKey for the reference., getObject, which will loaded the object from memory or datasource.

hasReferenceObjectBeenLoaded

public static boolean hasReferenceObjectBeenLoaded(OAObject oaObj,
                                                   java.lang.String propertyName)
Checks to see if the actual value for a property has been loaded. This will also check to see if a reference ObjectKey was loaded and the "real" object is in memory.

loadProperties

public static void loadProperties(OAObject oaObj,
                                  java.lang.String... propertyPaths)
Used to preload data, this will recursively load all references in the given Property Paths.

Parameters:
oaObj - root object to use.
propertyPaths - one or more propertyPaths, that can be loaded using a single visit to each property.

copyInto

public static void copyInto(OAObject oaObj,
                            OAObject newObject,
                            java.lang.String[] excludeProperties,
                            OACopyCallback copyCallback)
Copies the properties and some of the links from a source object (this) to a new object. For links of type One, all of the links are used, the same ref object from the source object is used. For links of type Many, only the owned links are used, and clones of the objects are created in the Hub of the new object. OACopyCallback can be used to control what is copied.

_copyInto

public static void _copyInto(OAObject oaObj,
                             OAObject newObject,
                             java.lang.String[] excludeProperties,
                             OACopyCallback copyCallback,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> hmNew)

                                         OAObject obj2,
                                         int maxLevelsToCheck)
Find the common Hub that two objects are descendants of.

Parameters:
currentLevel - current level of parents that have been checked
maxLevelsToCheck - total number of parents to check
